TunableEnum.name: BUYER_NAME_TYPE
TunableEnum.description: The SimNameType to use for generating buyer names.

TunableTuple.name: CUSTOM_TOOLTIP_TUNING
TunableTuple.description: Any object that is listed or pending sale on the object marktplace will have this custom tooltip tuning prepending to its normal tooltip tuning.

TunableList.name: custom_tooltips
TunableList.description: List of possible tooltips that will be displayed on an object when moused over. Each tooltip has its set of tests which will be evaluated whenever the object its created or when its state changes. The test that passes its the tooltip that the object will display.

TunableTuple.description: Variation of tooltips that may show when an object is hover over. Which tooltip is shows will depend on the object_tests that are tuned.

TunableVariant.name: display_object_preference
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, will display autonomous preference for the specified tag in the tooltip.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The preference tag associated with the information to display.

TunableList.name: object_tests
TunableList.description: All least one subtest group (AKA one list item) must pass within this list for the tooltip values to be valid on the object.
A list of tests. All of these must pass for the group to pass.

TunableVariant.description: A single tunable test.

TunableTuple.name: animal_test
TunableTuple.description: Tests for animal assignments and homes.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: Returns the opposite of the test results.

TunableVariant.name: test_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of animal test to run.

TunableTuple.name: animal_assigned_to_target_home
TunableTuple.description: Test that returns true if all animals are assigned to a particular home. Will return False if any animal is not assigned to the target.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: Animal we're testing the assignment of.

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: Target home to test that the animal is assigned to.

TunableTuple.name: animal_gifting_is_ready
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test that tests if the animal's cooldowns are ready for gifting, can test general and category

TunableVariant.name: cooldown_op_variant
TunableVariant.description: Whether or not this should test against the general readiness, or category readiness

TunableTuple.name: category_cooldown_op
TunableTuple.description: This operation tests against category readiness

TunableEnum.name: tag
TunableEnum.description: Which tag category to test

TunableTuple.name: general_cooldown_op
TunableTuple.description: This operation tests against general readiness

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject initiating the test

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: The animal we're targeting

TunableTuple.name: animal_has_matching_preference
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test that tests if the animal has a preference that matches the requested preference.

TunableEnum.name: preference_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of preference that we'll test the tag against

TunableEnum.name: tag_to_test
TunableEnum.description: The tag (category) to test against

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: The animal we're targeting

TunableTuple.name: animal_is_homeless
TunableTuple.description: Test that returns true if all animal subjects are currently homeless.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: Animal to run the test on.

TunableTuple.name: are_all_preferences_known
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test that tests if the animal's cooldowns are ready for gifting, can test general and category

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject initiating the test

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: The animal we're targeting

TunableTuple.name: home_is_at_max_capacity
TunableTuple.description: Test that returns true if subject's home is currently at maximum capacity. If subject is tuned on an animal, run the test for the animal's assigned home. Otherwise, we assume it's the home itself.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: Animal or home to run the test on.

TunableTuple.name: sim_has_animal_preference_knowledge
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test that tests if the sim's household has knowledge of a specific preference

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject initiating the test

TunableEnum.name: tag_to_test
TunableEnum.description: The tag (category) to test against

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: The animal we're targeting

TunableTuple.name: consumable_test
TunableTuple.description: A test that checks information about consumables.

TunableTuple.name: bites_left
TunableTuple.description: A check that tests against the number of bites left before the subject is completely consumed.

TunableEnum.name: operator
TunableEnum.description: The operator to use for the comparison.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The number of bites to test against.

Tunable.name: is_consumable
Tunable.description: If checked, the subject must be a consumable, if unchecked, the subject must not be a consumable.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject of the test. This is the consumable object.

TunableTuple.name: custom_name
TunableTuple.description: Require or prohibit an object from having a custom name or description set.

TunableVariant.name: has_custom_description
TunableVariant.description: If checked, the subject must have a custom description set. If unchecked, it cannot have a custom description set.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If checked, the subject must have a custom description set. If unchecked, it cannot have a custom description set.

TunableVariant.name: has_custom_name
TunableVariant.description: If checked, the subject must have a custom name set. If unchecked, it cannot have a custom name set.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If checked, the subject must have a custom name set. If unchecked, it cannot have a custom name set.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The subject who is the object of this test.

TunableTuple.name: existence
TunableTuple.description: A test to check whether the specified participant exists.

Tunable.name: allow_hidden_sim_status
Tunable.description: If checked then we will ignore hidden Sim status such that they will count as existing even though they have been hidden. Use this in conjunction with Require Instantiated in order to determine the Sim's actual instantiated status.

Tunable.name: exists
Tunable.description: When checked, require the specified participant to exist. When unchecked, require the specified participant to not exist.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant for which to check existence.

Tunable.name: require_instantiatable
Tunable.description: If checked, the specified participant must be instantiatable. This is generally true for all Sims at LOD above MINIMUM.

TunableTuple.name: game_option
TunableTuple.description: Test whether or not a Sim has a specific gameplay option set.

TunableEnum.name: gameplay_option
TunableEnum.description: The gameplay option to test. This test will pass if this option is set.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If enabled, requires the option to be unset for the test to pass.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableTuple.name: in_inventory
TunableTuple.description: A test to check if the specified participant is in, or not in, an inventory of a particular type.

TunableList.name: inventory_types
TunableList.description: Inventory types to test against. If this is any, the test will consider ALL inventory types.

TunableEnum.description: The inventory type to test.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will check that the participant IS NOT in any of the specified inventory types. If disabled, we will check that the participant IS in at least one of the specified inventory types.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant to test.

Tunable.name: test_hidden
Tunable.description: If enabled, will test whether the participant is in the hidden storage of the inventory or not, based on the value of negate. If this is enabled and negate is not, we require the object to be in the hidden storage of the inventory. If this enabled and negate is enabled, we require that the object is not in the hidden storage of the inventory.

TunableTuple.name: inventory
TunableTuple.description: A test to check on the contents of either a sim inventory or an object inventory.

TunableVariant.name: contents_check
TunableVariant.description: Checks to run on each object of the specified inventory

TunableTuple.name: scheduled_situation_special_object_test
TunableTuple.description: Check if an object is the special object for a drama node's situation.

TunableEnum.name: host_sim
TunableEnum.description: The sim to compare against the host sim of a situation.

TunableVariant.name: object_tags
TunableVariant.description: Tagging requirements on the object.

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for.

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.name: situation_type
Tunable.description: The type of situations you want to look for.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableTuple.name: has_object_of_participant_type
TunableTuple.description: Participant type we want to test if its in the selected inventory.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Which participant of the interaction do we want to validate on the inventory.

TunableTuple.name: has_object_passing_collection_tests
TunableTuple.description: Check if an object passes the specified Collection Tests.
Tests for a provided amount of a given collection type.

TunableEnum.name: collection_type
TunableEnum.description: The collection we are checking on. If collection type is unidentified then we will look through all collections.

Tunable.name: complete_collection
Tunable.description: Setting this to True (checked) will check for collection completed.

TunableEnum.name: counting_method
TunableEnum.description: Specify what we're checking the collection threshold of. COLLECTION: Count number of collectables collected - specified by Collection Type (either a particular collection, or all collections) - specified by Specific Items or Specific Targeting (the collections of those items) DEFINITION: Check whether a definition id has been collected or not - specified by Specific Items or Specific Targeting LEGACY: Choose counting method automatically (not recommended). DEFINITION will be preferred when possible over COLLECTION.

Tunable.name: fail_if_potentially_invalid
Tunable.description: Setting to True will cause this test to fail if any provided definition has any Collected Invalid States (from objects.collection_manager) tuned.

Tunable.name: incomplete_collection
Tunable.description: Setting this to True (checked) will check for collection incomplete.

TunableVariant.name: specific_items
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then the collection threshold test will check for specific items within the collection.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: List of allowed objects within a collection that we want to check.

Tunable.description: Object reference to each collectible object.

TunableVariant.name: specific_targeting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then the collection threshold test will check the provided target definitions within the collection.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: Definition IDs or objects to apply collection test to.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: Threshold for the collection test.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of the threshold that the collection is compared against.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableEnum.name: who
TunableEnum.description: The sim whose household to test collection against.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The object definition to look for inside inventory.

TunableTuple.name: has_object_with_states
TunableTuple.description: This option tests crafted item's tags against a list of possible tags.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The object must have this definition.

TunableTuple.name: tag
TunableTuple.description: The object must have this tag.

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tag of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.description: What state to test for.

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the states in the state set against the objects in the inventory.

TunableTuple.name: has_object_with_tag
TunableTuple.description: This option tests crafted item's tags against a list of possible tags

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tag of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.name: get_total_count
Tunable.description: If disabled, we will stop searching the inventory as soon as we meet the required count, resulting in a partial count of the inventory. If enabled, we will search the entire inventory in order to get an accurate count of the inventory. Enable this option if you are interested in the total count of the inventory, such as during calculations.

TunableVariant.name: inventory_location
TunableVariant.description: Who owns the inventory. Either look in the inventory of a participant or specify an object inventory type directly. If participant returns multiple inventory owners, the test will pass only if ALL of those owners pass the inventory content test.

TunableEnum.name: inventory
TunableEnum.description: Check in the hidden inventory for objects that can go into the specified inventory type. EX: check that there are mailbox objects in the hidden inventory

TunableEnum.name: inventory
TunableEnum.description: Check the global Object inventory that has the specified type. EX: check in the global fridge inventory that exists for all fridges

TunableEnum.name: inventory
TunableEnum.description: The owner of the inventory

TunableTuple.name: required_count
TunableTuple.description: The inventory must have a tunable threshold of objects that pass the contents check test. EX: test is object definition of type pizza. required count is enabled and has a threshold of >= 5. That means this test will pass if you have 5 or more pizzas in your inventory. To check if any objects exist, use required count >= 1

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableEnum.name: test_hidden
TunableEnum.description: Optionally restrict to only hidden or non-hidden inventories.

TunableTuple.name: location
TunableTuple.description: Tests for object locations. Outside: Check if an object is on the inside or outside (has a roof over its head) Natural ground: Checks the floor tiles where the object is to see if it qualifies as natural ground

TunableVariant.name: has_terrain_tag
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify the subject of the test is currently on the tuned terrain tag.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: , A set of terrain tags required for this test to pass.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, the test will be inverted. In other words, the test will fail if at least one tag is detected at this location.

TunableList.name: terrain_tags
TunableList.description: A set of terrain tags. Only one of these tags needs to be present at this location. Although it is not tunable, there is a threshold weight underneath which a terrain tag will not appear to be present.

Tunable.name: test_floor_tiles
Tunable.description: If checked, floor tiles will be tested. Otherwise, it'll only check the terrain and will ignore the floor tiles on the terrain.

TunableVariant.name: in_common_area
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify the subject is in the common area of an apartment. If unchecked will verify the subject is not.

TunableVariant.name: is_fire_allowed
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify if fire is possible at the subject's position. If unchecked, will pass if fire is not possible. If not enabled, doesn't care either way.

TunableVariant.name: is_in_pond
TunableVariant.description: If checked, test if the subject is inside a pond. If unchecked, test if the subject is not inside a pond. If disabled, don't care either way.

TunableVariant.name: is_in_slot
TunableVariant.description: If enabled will test if the object is attacked/deattached to any of possible tuned slots. If you tune a slot type set the test will test if the object is slotted or not slotted into into any of those types.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Test if an object is current slotted in any of a possible list of slot types. Empty slot type set is allowed for testing for slotted or not slotted only.

TunableVariant.name: slot_test_type
TunableVariant.description: Strategy to test the slots: Any Slot - is the object in any slot Surface Slot - is object is in a surface slot Specific Slot - is the object in specific list of slots

TunableTuple.name: any_slot
TunableTuple.description: Singleton factory for testing if object is slotted.

Tunable.name: require_slotted
Tunable.description: If checked, return success if the object is slotted If unchecked, test the absense of slotting.

TunableTuple.name: specific_slot
TunableTuple.description: Subclass of SlotTestType that can check against a specific slot set.

Tunable.name: require_slotted
Tunable.description: If checked, return success if the object is slotted If unchecked, test the absense of slotting.

Tunable.name: specific_slot_set
Tunable.description: Set of slots the object may be attached to.

TunableTuple.name: surface_slot
TunableTuple.description: Subclass of SlotTestType that checks that a slot has is_surface set to true.

Tunable.name: require_slotted
Tunable.description: If checked, return success if the object is slotted If unchecked, test the absense of slotting.

TunableVariant.name: is_inside_building
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify if the subject of the test is inside a building. This uses a client function that checks if the block the sim is mostly enclosed by walls or if not, if the adjoining blocks are themselves enclosed. This should be used when we want to test if a subject is inside a normally constructed building. If we simply want to test whether the subject is covered / has a roof over them, use is_outside. See comment on is_outside for more details. If unchecked, will negate this test.

TunableVariant.name: is_natural_ground
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify the subject of the test is on natural ground (no floor tiles are under him). Otherwise, will verify the subject of the test is not on natural ground.

TunableVariant.name: is_on_active_lot
TunableVariant.description: If disabled the test will not be used. If enabled and checked, the test will pass if the subject is on the active lot. (their center is within the lot bounds) If enabled and not checked, the test will pass if the subject is outside of the active lot. For example, Ask To Leave is tuned with this enabled and checked for the TargetSim. You can only ask someone to leave if they are actually on the active lot, but not if they are wandering around in the open streets.

TunableTuple.name: Is_or_is_not_on_active_lot
TunableTuple.display: Is Or Is Not On Active Lot

Tunable.name: include_spawn_point
Tunable.description: If set to true, we will consider the lot's spawn point as part of the active lot.

Tunable.name: is_or_is_not_on_active_lot
Tunable.display: Is Or Is Not On Active Lot
Tunable.description: If checked then the test will pass if the subject is on the active lot.

Tunable.name: explicit
Tunable.description: The tolerance from the edge of the lot that the location test will use in order to determine if the test target is considered on lot or not.

TunableTuple.name: use_default_tolerance
TunableTuple.description: Use the default tuned global offlot tolerance tuned in objects.components.statistic_component.Default Off Lot.

TunableVariant.name: is_on_level
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we check the participant's current level against the tuned threshold. In the case of sims in pools, the effective level will be that of the surface of the pool, not the bottom.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Value/comparison pair used to define a Threshold.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: is_outside
TunableVariant.description: PLEASE BE AWARE. If checked, will verify if the subject of the test does not have a roof over their head. If unchecked, will test if the subject has a roof over their head. If the intention is to determine if a subject is in/not in a building, this test is deprecated in favor of is_inside_building. If you would like to test if a subject is inside a building, but also need to test if they have a roof over their head, please use both options.

TunableVariant.name: is_venue_type
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify if the subject is at a venue of the specified type.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Venue type required for this test to pass.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If enabled, the test will return true if the subject IS NOT at a venue of the specified type.

Tunable.name: use_source_venue
Tunable.description: If enabled, the test will test the source venue instead of the active venue. For example, the Community Lot instead of the active Marketplace. Testing the active venue is the default.

Tunable.name: venue_type
Tunable.description: Venue type to test against.

TunableVariant.name: valid_surface_types
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will test the surface type of the subject against prohibited or required surface types.

TunableTuple.name: Test_Surface_Types
TunableTuple.description: Required and Prohibited Surface Types.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

TunableEnum.description: Surface Type the object is placed on.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

TunableEnum.description: Surface Type the object is placed on.

TunableTuple.name: object_definition
TunableTuple.description: Check to see if the specified object matches either a static definition or a set of tags

TunableVariant.name: item
TunableVariant.description: Whether to test for a specific item or item that has a set of tags

TunableTuple.name: actual_item
TunableTuple.description: This option tests crafted item against a list of possible items

Tunable.description: Object that qualifies for this check.

TunableTuple.name: tagged_item
TunableTuple.description: This option tests crafted item's tags against a list of possible tags

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tag of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableTuple.name: object_preference
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that checks whether or not the target object of an affordance is the Sim's preferred scoring object.

TunableVariant.name: any_sim
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, will return whether the object has any 'Use Only' preference set for the specified tag. Will not be sim specific, and thus only works for 'use only' preference type. Does NOT rely on interaction to determine preference type. Value is the tag to test for.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: Tag to determine which preference type to use.

Tunable.name: require
Tunable.description: The Sim's preference is required to be True or required to be False.

TunableTuple.name: season
TunableTuple.description: SeasonTest will test if the current simulation time falls within the specified test conditions.

Tunable.name: requires_seasons_pack
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will require that the Seasons pack be installed in order for the seasons test to pass. If unchecked, this test will automatically pass.

TunableList.name: seasons
TunableList.description: Season(s) that we must be in to pass the test.

TunableVariant.name: time_of_season
TunableVariant.description: Portion(s) of season(s) that we must be in to pass the test.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Portion(s) of season(s) that we must be in to pass the test.

TunableTuple.name: state
TunableTuple.description: Gate availability by object state. By default, the test will use the state's linked stat as a fallback in case the target doesn't have the state involved.

TunableVariant.name: fallback_behavior
TunableVariant.description: What to do if the given object doesn't have the state in question.

TunableEnum.name: operator
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to use.

Tunable.name: test_individual
Tunable.description: If true, the test will pass if any of the objects meet the criteria. If false, all objects have meet them.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value to compare to.

TunableTuple.name: street_civic_policy_test
TunableTuple.description: Test the state of the selected Street's Civic Policy Provider.

TunableList.name: civic_policy_tests
TunableList.description: The tests we wish to run on the civic policies in question, run in order. AND operation, all must pass, first to fail stops tests.

TunableVariant.description: Individual tests run on Civic Policy Provider.

TunableTuple.name: available
TunableTuple.description: Test available policies. Available policies include everything tuned.

TunableTuple.name: white_black_list
TunableTuple.description: The civic policies must pass the whitelist and blacklist to pass the test.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

Tunable.description: Allowed and disallowed civic policies.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

TunableTuple.name: balloted
TunableTuple.description: Test balloted policies. Policies being considered by the next/current vote are balloted.

TunableTuple.name: voting_open
TunableTuple.description: If checked, will verify that voting is currently active.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked then this test will return True when not active.

TunableTuple.name: voting_time_until_change
TunableTuple.description: If checked, will check the time remaining before the next voting open status change.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The amount of time relative to the next voting state change to test.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: Duration before the next change.

Tunable.name: days
Tunable.description: Number of days

Tunable.name: hours
Tunable.description: Number of hours

Tunable.name: minutes
Tunable.description: Number of minutes

TunableVariant.name: street
TunableVariant.description: Select what street to test.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: Identify a specific Street.

TunableTuple.name: via_street_participant
TunableTuple.description: Get the street participant.

TunableVariant.name: via_zone_source
TunableVariant.description: Select the street to use by specifying a Zone Source.

TunableTuple.name: use_current_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get the active zone.

TunableTuple.name: use_participant_home_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get a participant's home zone. Can be None if they don't have one.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Test against the participant's home zone. Townies' home zone will be None.

TunableTuple.name: use_pick_info
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone of the lot the user clicked on.

TunableTuple.name: use_picked_zone_ids
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone from the interaction's picked_zone_ids participant. Usually comes from a picker.

TunableList.name: tooltip_fields
TunableList.description: Mapping of tooltip fields to its localized values. Since this fields are created from a system originally created for recipes, all of them may be tuned, but these are the most common fields to show on a tooltip: - recipe_name = This is the actual title of the tooltip. This is the main text - recipe_description = This description refers to the main text that will show below the title - header = Smaller text that will show just above the title - subtext = Smaller text that will show just bellow the title

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: Fields to be populated in the tooltip. These fields will be populated with the text and tokens tuned.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: A class defining the text and tokens that will be interpreted when building an object's tooltip.

TunableVariant.name: override_component_information
TunableVariant.description: When override component fields is chosen, this tooltip field tuning will have the highest priority over what data is displayed. So if an object has some fields set by the crafting component or name component, if this is set, this will trump that information. When concatenate with component fields is set, you have the option to combine the tooltip information given by the a component with any string you decide to add. Example: If we choose to override component fields on the recipe_name field of a craftable we will override the recipe_name that gets set by the crafting system. If we choose to concatenate we could have things like recipe_name, my_new_text

TunableTuple.name: concatenate_with_component_fields
TunableTuple.description: Class defining how the string on a specified tooltip will be concatenated.

TunableEnum.name: concatenation_style
TunableEnum.description: Style of concatenation that ill be use between the two fields on the tunable. Example: Using COMMA_SEPARATION = 'string1, string' Using NEW_LINE_SEPARATION = 'string1 string' Using CONCATENATE_SEPARATION string1 and string will be concatenated but the order will change depending on the language. For example if we concatenated the tested state of a potion we will want the string 'Tested Reaper Potion' as a concatenated string, but this will be different in other languanges as the following example shows: English e.g. {0.String} {1.String} {'Untested'} {'Reaper Potion'} Spanish e.g. {1.String} {0.String} {'Pocion de muerte} {'sin probar'} So whenever you select CONCATENATE_SEPARATION be aware that the order will be given by the language itself.

TunableEnum.name: concatenation_type
TunableEnum.description: Type of concatenation that will be used on the tuned field and the component field. Example: We tune the text 'Crafted by Sim', and we tune it to CONCATENATE BEFORE result would be: Crafted by Sim CONCATENATION_STYLE RecipeName If we tune it to be CONCATENATE AFTER result will be: RecipeName CONCATENATION_STYLE Crafted by Sim

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Text that will be displayed on the tuned tooltip_fields of the tooltip.

TunableTuple.name: concatenation
TunableTuple.description: A list of localized string concatenations. These strings will be joined together into single line-separated string

TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: single
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableTuple.name: variation
TunableTuple.description: A list of possible localized string variations.

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableVariant.name: text_tokens
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, localization tokens to be passed into 'text' can be explicitly defined. For example, you could use a participant that is not normally used, such as a owned sim. Or you could also pass in statistic and commodity values. If disabled, the standard tokens from the interaction will be used (such as Actor and TargetSim). Participants tuned here should only be relevant to objects. If you try to tune a participant which only exist when you run an interaction (e.g. carry_target) tooltip wont show anything.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A class returning a list of objects that can be passed into localization strings as tokens.

TunableList.name: tokens
TunableList.description: A list of tokens that will be returned by this factory. Any string that uses this token will have token '0' be set to the first element, '1' to the second element, and so on. Do not let the list inheritance values confuse you; regardless of what the list element index is, the first element will always be 0, the second element 1, and so on.

TunableVariant.description: Define what the token at the specified index is.

TunableTuple.name: animal_home
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the animal home.

TunableVariant.name: animal_home_data
TunableVariant.description: Data you'd like to fetch about the animal home.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch specified data. This is expected to resolve to an Animal Home.

TunableTuple.name: associated_club
TunableTuple.description: The token is a stored 'associated_club' on this interaction. Only works with ClubMixerInteractions or ClubSuperInteractions.

TunableTuple.name: buck_amount
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number repesenting the amount of the specified buck type the specified participant has.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified statistic's value.

TunableTuple.name: buff_duration_remaining
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the remaining duration of a buff

Tunable.name: buff
Tunable.description: The buff whose duration we want to fetch.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified buff duration.

TunableTuple.name: career_data
TunableTuple.description: The token is a localized string, number, or Sim, representing the specified career data for the specified participant.

TunableVariant.name: career_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

Tunable.name: career_type
Tunable.description: The career we care about.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant's whose career data we care about.

TunableTuple.name: civic_policy
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the Civic Policy system.

TunableVariant.name: civic_policy_data
TunableVariant.description: The specific value to display.

TunableTuple.name: custom_schedule_assignment
TunableTuple.description: Token for a sim's assignment preset display name.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: , The participant who's assignment name we want to display.

TunableTuple.name: definition
TunableTuple.description: A catalog definition to use as a token. This is useful if you want to properly localize an object's name or description.

TunableTuple.name: game_component_data
TunableTuple.description: The token is a localized number or Sim representing the specified game component data from game component.

TunableVariant.name: game_component_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant's from whom the game component data we want to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: gig_history
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display data from gig history.

TunableVariant.name: customer_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the participant representing the customer in gig history. If disabled, falls back to searching for any valid gig in history.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: TargetSim searches for provided customer sim. Lot will search for the current lot.

TunableVariant.name: gig_history_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableEnum.name: max_gig_result
TunableEnum.description: The worst acceptable gig result to find.

TunableEnum.name: min_gig_result
TunableEnum.description: The worst acceptable gig result to find.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant whose gig history we will search.

TunableTuple.name: global_policy
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display data from the tuned global policy.

Tunable.name: global_policy
Tunable.description: The global policy from which data is displayed.

TunableEnum.name: token_property
TunableEnum.description: Which property from the Global Policy Token to use. NAME will use the policy's display name, PROGRESS will use the progress made over the max progress value.

TunableTuple.name: lifestyle_brand
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display the name of a Lifestyle Brand owned by a Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who owns the lifestyle brand.

TunableTuple.name: luck
TunableTuple.description: Token for a sim's Luck level.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who's luck level we want to display.

TunableTuple.name: money_amount
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number representing the amount of Simoleons that were awarded in loot to the specified participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant for whom we fetch the earned amount of money.

TunableTuple.name: object_fashion_marketplace
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the object fashion marketplace component and fashion marketplace system.

TunableVariant.name: object_fashion_marketplace_data
TunableVariant.description: Please select what value you would like to use.

TunableTuple.name: object_marketplace
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the object marketplace component and marketplace system.

TunableVariant.name: object_marketplace_data
TunableVariant.description: Please select what value you would like to use.

TunableTuple.name: object_property
TunableTuple.description: The token is a property of a game object. This could be catalog properties like its price or its rarity which is a property given by a component.

TunableEnum.name: obj_property
TunableEnum.description: The property of the object that we will request.

TunableTuple.name: object_state_value
TunableTuple.description: The token is a string representing the value of a specific state from the selected participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified state's value.

Tunable.name: state
Tunable.description: The state's whose value we want to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: participant_count
TunableTuple.description: The number of participants of the specified type.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableList.name: by_set_of_references
TunableList.description: A set of references that the objects should be in.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: participant_type
TunableTuple.description: The token is a Sim or object participant from the interaction.

TunableVariant.name: formatter
TunableVariant.description: Define the format for this token.

TunableTuple.name: bullet_list
TunableTuple.description: The token is a string, which is a formatted bullet point list. Objects are grouped by definition. The text for each item must be specified.

Tunable.name: bullet_text
Tunable.description: The text for the bullet entry. The string is provided the following tokens, in this order: 0 An object representitive of the group 1 The number of objects in the group

TunableTuple.name: single
TunableTuple.description: The token is a single object name. If multiple participants are returned, an arbitrary one is used. That is, unless the mismatch key is specified. In that case, the string is used unless all of the participants' definitions match.

TunableVariant.name: mismatch_name
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the object name to use when using a multi- object participant yielding definitions with different names.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableList.name: by_set_of_references
TunableList.description: A set of references that the objects should be in.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: participant_type_special
TunableTuple.description: The token is a specified string grabbed from a supported participant type that requires special handling. Currently supported are: I. Participants that resolve into households 1. Household Name 2. Household Description 2. Participants that resolve into zone ids 1. Lot Name 2. Lot Description 3. Name of household that lives there 4. Description of household that lives there.

TunableTuple.name: household
TunableTuple.description: Helper class used to support participants that resolve into households.

TunableVariant.name: attribute
TunableVariant.description: Which string we are interested in.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Participant that resolves to a household.

TunableTuple.name: zone
TunableTuple.description: Helper class used to support participants that resolve into zone ids.

TunableVariant.name: attribute
TunableVariant.description: Which string we are interested in.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Participant that resolves to zone id of a multi unit business.

TunableTuple.name: picked_part
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display the name of a picked part.

TunableTuple.name: scholarship_letter_component_data
TunableTuple.description: The token can be used to get strings representing scholarship information from the scholarship letter component of an object.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom to get the scholarship letter component data.

TunableVariant.name: scholarship_letter_component_data

TunableTuple.name: sickness
TunableTuple.description: The token is the name of the sickness on the specified Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who is sick.

TunableTuple.name: small_business
TunableTuple.description: The token is the name of the small business owned by specified Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who has small business.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_value
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number representing the value of a specific statistic from the selected participant.

Tunable.name: clamp_value_to_floor
Tunable.description: If True, the value will be clamped to its floor.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified statistic's value.

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: The statistic's whose value we want to fetch.

Tunable.name: use_statistic_name
Tunable.description: If True, the value will be the name of the statistic.

TunableTuple.name: street
TunableTuple.description: Using the Street Selector tuning, provide a token localization appropriate street selection.

TunableVariant.name: street
TunableVariant.description: Select what street to test.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: Identify a specific Street.

TunableTuple.name: via_street_participant

TunableVariant.name: via_zone_source
TunableVariant.description: Select the street to use by specifying a Zone Source.

TunableTuple.name: use_current_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get the active zone.

TunableTuple.name: use_participant_home_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get a participant's home zone. Can be None if they don't have one.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Test against the participant's home zone. Townies' home zone will be None.

TunableTuple.name: use_pick_info
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone of the lot the user clicked on.

TunableTuple.name: use_picked_zone_ids
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone from the interaction's picked_zone_ids participant. Usually comes from a picker.

TunableVariant.name: street_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip_main_icon
TunableVariant.description: Main icon for the tooltip. Not all tooltip styles support tunable main icons. Consult your GPE and UI partners if you are unsure if this will work for your use case.

TunableEnum.name: tooltip_style
TunableEnum.description: Types of possible tooltips that can be displayed for an object. It's recomended to use default or HOVER_TIP_CUSTOM_OBJECT on most objects.

TunableTuple.name: DELIVERY_DURATION
TunableTuple.description: This is the amount of time between an object being sold and it being delivered.

Tunable.name: days
Tunable.description: Number of days

Tunable.name: hours
Tunable.description: Number of hours

Tunable.name: minutes
Tunable.description: Number of minutes

TunableTuple.name: LISTING_DURATION
TunableTuple.description: This is the duration of a listing on the fashion marketplace. After this time has elapsed, the listing will expire.

Tunable.name: days
Tunable.description: Number of days

Tunable.name: hours
Tunable.description: Number of hours

Tunable.name: minutes
Tunable.description: Number of minutes

Tunable.name: NO_BUYER_TEXT
Tunable.description: The text that will be used in place of a buyer name if this item does not have a buyer.

TunableTuple.name: OBJECT_FASHION_MARKETPLACE_BASE_VALUES
TunableTuple.description: The following fields represent the base values for properties of objects listed on the fashion marketplace. To tune specific values for a specific object, tune an ObjectFashionMarketplaceComponent on that object.

TunableTuple.name: base_list_cost_multiplier
TunableTuple.description: This is used to calculate the cost of listing an object on the fashion marketplace. This value will be multiplied by the catalog value of the object.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: base_sale_chance
TunableTuple.description: Base chance an object will sell.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: base_sale_price_multiplier
TunableTuple.description: This is used to calculate the sale price for selling object on the fashion marketplace. This value will be multiplied by the object's value as calculated by gameplay (affected by things like quality) to form a bonus. We will then randomly select a value between .5 times and 1 times that bonus and add it to the original value.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableList.name: OBJECT_FASHION_MARKETPLACE_PRICING_STATE_TUNING
TunableList.display: Object Fashion Marketplace Pricing State Tuning

TunableTuple.description: List to define the marketplace pricing state based on tunable thresholds to be used when selling an outfit on the Trendi marketplace to determine whether the player is selling extremely underpriced, underpriced, even, overpriced, extremely overprice

Tunable.name: state
Tunable.description: A state value to set on the object.

TunableList.name: thresholds
TunableList.description: A list of tunable thresholds, all of which must pass for this entry to be chosen as the marketplace price state.

TunableTuple.description: A threshold that must be met.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: OBJECT_FASHION_MARKETPLACE_STATE_TUNING
TunableTuple.description: Tuning relating to how objects behave as they are modified by the object fashion marketplace.

TunableTuple.name: delisted_tuning
TunableTuple.description: The tuning governing an object that has become delisted from the fashion marketplace. This tuning functions slightly differently from other fashion marketplace 'states' in that it is intended to set the object back to defaults that existed prior to the fashion marketplace

TunableList.name: enter_loot
TunableList.description: Loot actions to apply to an object and the sim selling it when this object enters this fashion marketplace state.

Tunable.name: state_value
Tunable.description: The ObjectStateValue to put an object in when it enters this fashion marketplace state.

TunableEnum.description: Tags that will be applied to an object when it enters this fashion marketplace state.

TunableTuple.name: delivered_tuning
TunableTuple.description: The tuning governing an object that has become delivered to a buyer. This tuning functions slightly differently from other fashion marketplace 'states' in that it is intended to set the object back to defaults that existed prior to the fashion marketplace

TunableList.name: enter_loot
TunableList.description: Loot actions to apply to an object and the sim selling it when this object enters this fashion marketplace state.

Tunable.name: state_value
Tunable.description: The ObjectStateValue to put an object in when it enters this fashion marketplace state.

TunableEnum.description: Tags that will be applied to an object when it enters this fashion marketplace state.

TunableTuple.name: expired_tuning
TunableTuple.description: The tuning governing an object that expires in the fashion marketplace.

TunableList.name: enter_loot
TunableList.description: Loot actions to apply to an object and the sim selling it when this object enters this fashion marketplace state.

Tunable.name: state_value
Tunable.description: The ObjectStateValue to put an object in when it enters this fashion marketplace state.

TunableEnum.description: Tags that will be applied to an object when it enters this fashion marketplace state.

TunableTuple.name: listed_tuning
TunableTuple.description: The tuning governing an object that is listed in the fashion marketplace.

TunableList.name: enter_loot
TunableList.description: Loot actions to apply to an object and the sim selling it when this object enters this fashion marketplace state.

TunableVariant.name: inventory_icon_visual_state
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, a string for the UI to determine what treatment should be done on this object when it is in the inventory. If un-tuned, no treatment will be done.

Tunable.name: state_value
Tunable.description: The ObjectStateValue to put an object in when it enters this fashion marketplace state.

TunableEnum.description: Tags that will be applied to an object when it enters this fashion marketplace state.

TunableTuple.name: pending_sale_tuning
TunableTuple.description: The tuning governing an object that is marked as pending sale in the fashion marketplace.

TunableList.name: enter_loot
TunableList.description: Loot actions to apply to an object and the sim selling it when this object enters this fashion marketplace state.

TunableVariant.name: inventory_icon_visual_state
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, a string for the UI to determine what treatment should be done on this object when it is in the inventory. If un-tuned, no treatment will be done.

Tunable.name: state_value
Tunable.description: The ObjectStateValue to put an object in when it enters this fashion marketplace state.

TunableEnum.description: Tags that will be applied to an object when it enters this fashion marketplace state.

TunableTuple.name: sold_tuning
TunableTuple.description: The tuning governing an object that is sold in the fashion marketplace.

TunableList.name: enter_loot
TunableList.description: Loot actions to apply to an object and the sim selling it when this object enters this fashion marketplace state.

Tunable.name: state_value
Tunable.description: The ObjectStateValue to put an object in when it enters this fashion marketplace state.

TunableEnum.description: Tags that will be applied to an object when it enters this fashion marketplace state.
